org.ambraproject.rhino.rest

Enum MetadataFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<MetadataFormat>
      • org.ambraproject.rhino.rest.MetadataFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<MetadataFormat>

    public enum MetadataFormat
extends Enum<MetadataFormat>
    A format for entity metadata, that can be sent to the client in response to a GET request.

      • getFromAcceptHeader

        public static MetadataFormat getFromAcceptHeader(String acceptHeaderValue)
        Provide a metadata format for a Accept header value. Match the content types listed in the header to the first available supported format, or return the default format if none of the formats listed is supported. If there is no Accept header, return the default format.

        This is the preferred way to get the metadata format in a controller method that doesn't otherwise need to receive an HttpServletRequest or HttpHeaders object from Spring.

        Example usage in controller: 

           @RequestMapping
   public void serve(@RequestHeader(value = "Accept", required = false) String accept) {
     MetadataFormat mf = getFromAcceptHeader(accept);
   }
        Parameters:
        acceptHeaderValue - the Accept header value from a request
        Returns:
        the metadata format to use

      • getFromRequest

        public static MetadataFormat getFromRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        Provide a metadata format for a request. Match the content types listed in the Accept header to the first available supported format, or return the default format if none of the formats listed is supported. If there is no Accept header, return the default format.

        In general, controllers should call this method only if they already receive an HttpServletRequest from Spring for some other reason. If you access the headers only to get the metadata format, prefer getFromAcceptHeader(String).

        Example usage in controller: 

           @RequestMapping
   public void serve(HttpServletRequest request) {
     MetadataFormat mf = MetadataFormat.getFromRequest(request);
   }
        Parameters:
        request - the request
        Returns:
        the metadata format to use

      • getFromHeaders

        public static MetadataFormat getFromHeaders(org.springframework.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Provide a metadata format for a set of headers. Match the content types listed in the Accept header to the first available supported format, or return the default format if none of the formats listed is supported. If there is no Accept header, return the default format.

        In general, controllers should call this method only if they already receive an HttpHeaders object from Spring for some other reason. If you access the headers only to get the metadata format, prefer getFromAcceptHeader(String).

        Example usage in controller: 

           @RequestMapping
   public void serve(@RequestHeader HttpHeaders headers) {
     MetadataFormat mf = getFromHeaders(headers);
   }
        Parameters:
        headers - the headers from a request
        Returns:
        the metadata format to use
